sentences.en: Alcohol affects the brain, making speech slurred and imprecise.
sentences.cn: 酒精影响大脑，使言语含糊不清。

sentences.en: But these methods are ery imprecise.
sentences.cn: 但是这些方法都不是很准确.

sentences.en: Causal relationships may also be affected by relatively imprecise measurements.
sentences.cn: 因果关系也许会受到不精确的测量法所影响.

sentences.en: Fuzzy theory allows us to model imprecise or vague data.
sentences.cn: 模糊的理论允许我们塑造不精确或隐晦的数据.

sentences.en: However, this term strikes others as too broad and imprecise.
sentences.cn: 不过, 这个术语因含义太泛和界定不精而向他人敲响了警钟.

sentences.en: Imprecise calculations show up as fuzz in the picture.
sentences.cn: 不精确的计算会使图像模糊.

sentences.en: It is recognized that human assessment of qualitative attributes is always subjective and imprecise.
sentences.cn: 这是公认的定性特征,人类的评价总是主观和准确.

sentences.en: She was rather imprecise about the cost of the trip.
Similar risks are inherent in the imprecise language respecting interference with competition.
sentences.cn: 此外,规定中有关干扰竞争的用语不够严密,也会带来类似的风险.

sentences.en: The charges were vague and imprecise.

sentences.cn: 这种综合当然是不严密的.

sentences.en: The old standard weight had to be replaced because it was imprecise.
sentences.cn: 旧的标准秤砣因为不精确只能被替换掉了.

sentences.en: The terminology of financial markets can be imprecise.
sentences.cn: 金融市场术语的定义也许不那么精准. ”

sentences.en: The terms he used were imprecise and emotional.
sentences.cn: 他使用的术语是模糊的和情绪化的.

sentences.en: The terms he used were imprecise.

sentences.cn: 他们的假设是不精确的.

words.tran_cn: 不精确的；不严密的；不确切的

trans.tran_cn: 不精确的，不确定的，含糊不清
